entry.title: Russia warns Armenia making future cooperation impossible

media:group.media:title: Russia warns Armenia making future cooperation impossible
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armeniaโs authorities charged five supporters of anti-government protests with hooliganism amid growing allegations of excessive use of force by police officers. ๐ A senior Russian diplomat claimed Yerevanโs โreckless decisionsโ to move away from its defense arrangements with Moscow may make future cooperation impossible. ๐ Azerbaijanโs top diplomat reported progress in ongoing efforts toward a normalization deal with Armenia, saying the number of โunresolved issuesโ had been reduced. ๐ U.S. President Joe Biden expressed hope an Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization deal would โtransformโ the South Caucasus in a letter to Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev. ๐ Armenia voted for the first time in favor of a Georgia-backed United Nations resolution affirming the right of displaced people to return to Abkhazia and South Ossetia.

entry.title: Inside Finland's holistic approach to defending sovereignty

media:group.media:title: Inside Finland's holistic approach to defending sovereignty
media:group.media:description:
In this exclusive discussion, CivilNet sits down with Finnish Ambassador to the South Caucasus Kirsti Narinen to get insights into Finland's comprehensive "Total Defense" strategy which fortifies the nation through close cooperation between the government, private sector and the public. Ambassador Narinen explains how this holistic model has allowed Finland to effectively respond to emergencies and modern security threats. She discusses key lessons that Armenia could adopt to strengthen its national resilience and crisis management capabilities.

entry.title: Russian-led military bloc says waiting for Armenia to โclarifyโ future relations

media:group.media:title: Russian-led military bloc says waiting for Armenia to โclarifyโ future relations
media:group.media:description:
๐ Archbishop Bagrat Galstanyan rallied his supporters in front of Armeniaโs Human Rights Defenderโs Office, demanding an independent probe into alleged cases of disproportionate use of force by police officers against anti-government protesters. ๐ Foreign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan called on Turkey to implement an agreement reached two years ago to partially reopen its border with Armenia, which as of now is still closed. ๐ Mirzoyan also said he does not believe Armeniaโs constitution poses an obstacle in ongoing efforts to reach a normalization deal with Azerbaijan, contradicting Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev, who has called for Armeniaโs constitution to be overhauled. ๐ The head of the Collective Security Treaty Organization said he expects Armenia to โclarify the prospects for their relationsโ with the Russian-led military bloc. Earlier, Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said he had โfrozenโ Armeniaโs membership in the alliance.

entry.title: Living with Down syndrome in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Living with Down syndrome in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Sixteen-year-old Sargis is Maro Avetisyan's second child. Born with Down syndrome, Sargis leads a rich and active life. He enjoys drawing, writing, performing in theater, attending college, and taking karate classes. He also frequents the Lousรฉ rehabilitation center. CivilNet spent a day with Sargis and his mother learn about both his challenges and triumphs.

ิตึึีกีถีซ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟ ีีซีฃึีกีถ ิฑีพีซีถีตีกีถีจ ิฟีซึีซ ึีกีฒีกึีกีบีฅีฟ ีีซีฟีกีฌีซ ิฟีฌีซีนีฏีธีตีซีถ ีฐึีกีพีซึีฅีฌ ีง ิตึึีกีถ, ีซีฝีฏ ีดีซีถีน ีกีตีค ิตึึีกีถีซ ีีธึ ีีธึึ ีพีกึีนีกีฏีกีถ ีทึีปีกีถีซ ีฒีฅีฏีกีพีกึีถ ีกีตึีฅีฌีฅีฌ ีง ีธึีฏึีกีซีถีกีฏีกีถ ิฒีธึีนีก ึีกีฒีกึ: ีึีกีถึ ีฆีธึีฟ ีิปี ีดีกีฏีกึีคีกีฏีธึีด ีกึีพีธีฒ ีฃีธึีฎีธีฒีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅีึ ีฅีถ, ีฉีฅี ีญีธีฝีธึีด ีฅีถ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถ-ีึีฏึีกีซีถีก ีดีซีปีบีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฐีกึีกีขีฅึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีฝีฅึีฟีกึีดีกีถ ีดีกีฝีซีถ: ิปีถีนีธีึ ีนีฅีถ ีฝีฏีฝีพีธึีด ิตีพึีกีดีซีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีฅีฟ ีพีซีฆีกีถีฅึีซ ีกีฆีกีฟีกีฏีกีถีกึีดีกีถ ีทีธึึีป ีขีกีถีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ, ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีจ ีฏีฝีฟีกีถีกี ีบีกีทีฟีบีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีธีฌีธึีฟีธึีด ีกีปีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ิตีพึีธีบีกีฏีกีถ ีีซีธึีฉีตีธึีถีซึ: ิฑีตีฝ ีฐีกึึีฅึีซ ีทีธึึีป ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ิฑึีทีกีฌีธึีตีฝ ีีฒีคีฅีฝีตีกีถีจ ีฆึีธึึีฅีฌ ีง ิฑิบ ิตีพึีธีบีกีฏีกีถ ีซีถีฟีฅีฃึีดีกีถ ีฐีกึึีฅึีซ ีดีทีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีฐีกีถีฑีถีกีชีธีฒีธีพีซ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ, ยซีีกีฒีกึีกึีซีกีฏีกีถ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีกีฃีซึยป ีญีดีขีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีบีกีฟีฃีกีดีกีพีธึ ิฑึีดีกีถ ิตีฒีธีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ:
